clusters.title: Three dead after light plane crashes into ocean off South Australian beach
clusters.neutral_headline: Three dead after light plane crashes into ocean off South Australian beach
bullet_summary: Police found the bodies of all three men on board , including the 57-year-old pilot and two teenagers
Reported by Guardian Australia, 9News, ABC News Australia

items.title: Three dead after light plane crashes into ocean off South Australian beach
items.standfirst: Single-engine Cessna crashed into water at Long Bay near Goolwa South on Friday afternoonGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastThree people have died after a light plane crashed into the ocean near Goolwa South in South Australia on Friday.Police responded to reports of the small plane crashing into the water at Long Bay about 4.20pm, with emergency services responding to the area immediately. Continue reading...
items.content: Single-engine Cessna crashed into water at Long Bay near Goolwa South on Friday afternoonGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastThree people have died after a light plane crashed into the ocean near Goolwa South in South Australia on Friday.Police responded to reports of the small plane crashing into the water at Long Bay about 4.20pm, with emergency services responding to the area immediately. Continue reading...

items.title: Three found dead after light plane plummeted into ocean off SA's south coast
items.standfirst: Police found the bodies of all three men on board , including the 57-year-old pilot and two teenagers.
items.content: Three men have been found dead after a light plane crashed into the ocean off SA's south coast.The aircraft crashed into the ocean in Long Bay, near Goolwa South, just before 4.30pm local time (5pm AEDT), with several people witnessing the accident.Police have since recovered the bodies of all three men who were on board , including the pilot, a 57-year-old Morphett Vale man, an 18-year-old Freeling man and a 19-year-old Pasadena man.READ MORE: Aussies dealt $250 billion blow as cost of controversial policy snowballs The wreckage of the light plane has been brought to shore.Emergency services, including water police and a helicopter, scoured the scene immediately after the crash.Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB) investigators will visit the site today as investigations into the crash continue.A report will also be prepared for the coroner. NEVER MISS A STORY: Get your breaking news and exclusive stories first by following us across all platforms.Download the 9NEWS App here via Apple and Google PlayMake 9News your preferred source on Google by ticking this box hereSign up to our breaking newsletter here

items.title: Three men dead after light plane crash, SA police say

items.content: Police were called to the Long Bay area near Goolwa South on Friday afternoon after reports of a light plane crashing into the ocean.
